Våra tjänster inkluderar facility management, transaktioner och projektledning; Fastighetsförvaltning; Investment management; Bedömning och värdering Fastighetsleasing Strategisk rådgivning; Fastighetsförsäljning; Inteckningstjänster och utvecklingstjänster.*

title: Cyber Security IAM Project Manager
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 As a IAM Project Manager, you will be leading the implementation, management, and monitoring of security measures across software, services, and IAM technology. With advanced knowledge of cybersecurity principles, you will ensure the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of organizational assets. Together with senior stakeholders, including project and product teams, you will ensure that security is integrated into the development and operational processes. As part of a strategic security initiative, you drive the ongoing evolution of security processes, strengthen data protection efforts, and ensure that best practices are implemented across the organization’s technology platforms and services.
   

  

* Project Management & Follow-up: Develop plans, track progress, ensure delivery, and maintain project documentation
* IAM Strategy & Compliance: Enforce IAM policies, update systems based on business needs and identify opportunities for improvement.
* Risk Management & Security: Assess and mitigate risks to ensure the effectiveness and security of the IAM system.
* Stakeholder & Communication Management: Maintain transparent communication, manage changes, and collaborate with key stakeholders.


**Who You’ll Work With**
 You will belong to our Cyber Security Architecture & Engineering team and be part of our sub-team called IAM Center of Excellence. The team’s scope of responsibility covers aspects from demand management to planning and prioritisation, while also assisting at the unit level by supporting Architecture and Engineering teams with strategic planning and alignment. We are set up to provide the organisation with a single point of contact for any IAM related matter within H&M.
   

  

**Who You Are**
*We are looking for people with…*
* Experience planning, leading, and following up on IAM and cyber security projects.
* Strong risk analysis skills
* Knowledge of implementation, regulatory frameworks, and standards (e.g., DORA, NIS).
* Solid project coordination and stakeholder management abilities
* A track record of driving technical and operational security initiatives
* Proficiency with Atlassian tools like Jira and Confluence


*And people who are…*
* Excited about Cyber Security
* Forward-thinking and have a strategic mindset
* Encouraging open and constructive discussions.
* Structured and organized, with the ability to manage complexity and keep projects on track
* Strong communicators who can engage with both technical and non-technical stakeholders and drive collaboration across teams


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

* All our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program (HIP)
* All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound.
* A dynamic, entrepreneurial environment where your insights directly influence strategic decisions.
* A collaborative culture that values innovation, continuous learning, and knowledge sharing.


**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 This is a
 **fulltime permanent position** 
 , starting as soon as possible according to agreement. The role is a hybrid position, based in our office in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

**Unfortunately relocation is not offered for this role.**
 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here!
   

  

* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: Cloud Engineer
description:
**Think in clouds. Build with purpose. Engineer the future.** 
 ⛅
   

  

 We're looking for a Cloud Engineer who's not just fluent in AWS, but excited by the endless possibilities it brings. In this role, you’ll collaborate with skilled Cloud and Platform Engineers to ensure our AWS infrastructure runs smoothly, securely, and efficiently. Join our dynamic team and become a key player in building, optimizing, and securing cutting-edge cloud environments!
   

  

**Get an idea of the role**
 As a Cloud Engineer, you will play a vital role within our cross-functional Commercial team, working closely alongside Cloud and Platform Engineers, as well as a Cybersecurity specialist.
   

  

 Your key responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Maintenance and monitoring of the AWS cloud infrastructure to ensure it is operating optimally, efficiently and patched against known vulnerabilities.
* Deploy and configure cloud services such as EC2, EKS, storage, databases, and networking.
* Troubleshoot issues in the cloud infrastructure, ranging from service downtime to security breaches, ensuring seamless operations.
* Streamlining deployment processes and scaling of cloud-based applications through effective automation.
* Taking part in the ambulatory emergency service (every 5-6th week


**Skills & Experience**
 We believe that you have:
   

  

* 5+ years of experience as a Cloud Engineer
* Strong knowledge of AWS Cloud Infrastructure such as EKS, S3, RDS, CloudWatch, EC2, RabbitMQ, ElastiCache, VPC, CloudTrail, and Secret Manager.
* Solid understanding of container orchestration tools like Kubernetes, coupled with knowledge of CI/CD principles is a must-have.
* Experience with provisioning the infrastructure & configuration management deployment tools like Crossplane, Terraform and CloudFormation.
* Familiarity with networking concepts as well as monitoring and logging tools.


 On a personal level, we believe that you take ownership of your work and are a proactive communicator that enjoys collaborating effectively with team members.
   

  

**Resurs in brief**
 At Resurs, we make everyday finances easier through innovative and customer-focused solutions. With customers across the Nordics and more than 800 colleagues, we are committed to creating long-term value for individuals, businesses, and society. Recognized as a career company for the past six years, we put strong emphasis on both personal and professional growth. We want to make a difference by striving to be our best, acting with kindness, and building trust through clarity and collaboration. Our heart beats strong and it shows in everything we do.
   

  

 Although we are based in the Nordics, we are enriched by the breadth of perspectives brought by colleagues from different countries. We foster a welcoming and supportive culture, where collaboration drives us to achieve the best outcomes for our users.
   

  

**Apply today!**
 Don’t wait to send in your application - selection, and interviews take place on an ongoing basis and the position may be filled before the last advertising date. We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

**Important information**
 On final candidates, we carry out a detailed background check via an external company
   

  

* In this recruitment process, the supplier is solely responsible for the personal data they collect and process. Resurs is solely responsible for the personal data processed by us in the recruitment process.


 Resurs has almost 50 years of experience in retail finance and is one of the leading niche banks in the Nordics. We help companies and private individuals with lending, savings and payments. Today, we have a customer base of slightly more than 6 million customers and around 800 employees in the Nordic region.
   

  

 Follow us on Instagram:
   

  

 Resurs.Sverige
   

  

 Resurs.Norge
   

  

 Resurs.Suomi
   

  

 Resurs.Danmark

title: Medicinteknisk ingenjör
description:
Sök rollen som medicinteknisk ingenjör!
   

  

**Om oss**
 Hos oss blir du en del av ett litet men kraftfullt team på fyra medicintekniska ingenjörer. Vi är ett sammansvetsat gäng som har nära till skratt, nära till varandra – och nära till verksamheterna vi stöttar. Det betyder att du inte bara får jobba med avancerad teknik, utan också får se det verkliga värdet av ditt arbete varje dag: tryggare, säkrare och mer effektiv vård.
   

  

 Vi arbetar inom hela Affärsområde Medicinsk Diagnostik – och mer därtill. Vårt arbete omfattar allt från installation och förebyggande underhåll till akuta felsökningar och strategiska förbättringar. Oavsett om det gäller laboratoriemiljöer, bild- och funktionsdiagnostik eller andra delar av vårdens tekniska system, är vi där det behövs som mest.
   

  

 Vi strävar ständigt framåt. Tekniken utvecklas snabbt, och det gör vi också. Hos oss får du utrymme att växa, påverka och bidra – både i det dagliga arbetet och i hur vi formar framtidens medicintekniska stöd i vården. Vi är kända för vår höga kompetens, vårt engagemang och vår förmåga att hitta lösningar när det verkligen gäller. Det är ingen slump att vi ses som det självklara valet när vården behöver teknisk expertis.
   

  

 Vill du vara med på resan? Välkommen till oss
   

  

**Rollen**
 Som medicinteknisk ingenjör hos oss får du en varierad och viktig roll med stort ansvar och nära kontakt med vårdens olika verksamheter. Du deltar i den dagliga verksamheten och planerar den medicintekniska driften, samtidigt som du stöttar verksamheterna i tekniska frågor.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter innefattar:**
* Delta i den dagliga verksamheten
* Planera och organisera den medicintekniska verksamheten
* Utföra avhjälpande underhåll
* Genomföra ankomstkontroller
* Utföra förebyggande underhåll
* Installera medicinteknisk utrustning
* Kalibrera utrustningar
* Stödja verksamheten vid inköp av medicinteknisk utrustning
* Stödja kravställning av nätverk och IT-komponenter för medicintekniska system
* Medverka i utformning och underhåll av förvaltningsplaner
* Utföra tekniska valideringar vid behov


 Rollen är bred och utvecklande – perfekt för dig som vill kombinera teknik, problemlösning och samhällsnytta i en vårdnära miljö
   

  

**Om dig**
 Du har:
   

  

* Högskoleexamen inom medicinteknik, alternativt praktiskt förvärvade kunskaper motsvarande detta
* Goda kunskaper och förståelse för datorer, nätverk och IT-säkerhet
* Kunskaper och förståelse av GDPR
* Kunskaper kring krav gällande ackreditering och standarder
* Erfarenhet/god kunskap inom IT området
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i såväl tal som skrift
* B-Körkort


**Meriterande**
 Yrkeserfarenhet av arbete inom medicinsk teknik och utrustningstyper som exempelvis:
   

  

* Vilo- och arbets-EKG
* Perifercirkulationsutredning (PCU)
* Spirometri
* Ultraljud
* Endoskopi
* Data/Bildlagringssytem
* Operationsutrustning
* Övrig medicinteknisk utrustning


 Vi lägger stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som är nyfiken, engagerad och gillar att lösa problem tillsammans med andra – någon som vill använda sin tekniska kompetens för att göra verklig skillnad i vården.
   

  

**Anställningsvillkor**
 Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning, som inleds med 6 månaders provanställning
   

  

 Omfattning: Heltid
   

  

 Tillträde: Enligt överenskommelse
   

  

 Lön: Individuell lönesättning
   

  

 Kollektivavtal finns
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Urval och intervjuer kommer att ske löpande så dröj inte med att skicka in din ansökan. Har du frågor om tjänsten? Kontakta gärna enhetschef Alexandros Mparkertzakis på mejl alexandros.mpakertzakis@aleris.se.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Backend Engineer - Music
description:
Spotify’s mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their work and billions of fans the opportunity to enjoy and be inspired by it. The Music Mission team is responsible for Spotify’s end-to-end proposition for music creators and the experiences they create for fans.
   

  

 The Music Publishing R&D team provides a suite of products that enable songwriters, producers, and publishers to make the most of their music on Spotify. This includes global analytics that help publishers to understand their catalog and land the best opportunities for songwriters and producers; clickable writer credits on Spotify; and Songwriter Pages & Written By playlists for writers to showcase their written work.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Implement technical strategy for a suite of publishing tools, services, and features.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams of data, backend, and fullstack engineers to deliver robust, production-ready solutions.
* Work in an environment where engineers are empowered to take ownership from ideation to production.


 Who You Are
   

  

* Technical Expert: You bring expertise in Java, distributed systems, front end web and data engineering.
* Collaborative: You thrive in cross-functional teams, working closely with product managers, designers, platform teams, and leadership to deliver exceptional experiences.
* You’re able to handle multiple moving pieces and adapt to changing scope or timelines.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in Stockholm.
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Senior IT Säkerhetsspecialist
company_industry: Defense and Space Manufacturing, Security and Investigations, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
*Vill du påverka och göra skillnad på riktigt? Här bidrar du till att skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen. Det du gör spelar roll* 
*.*
*Din roll*
 I den här rollen får du möjlighet att spela en avgörande roll i utvecklingen av våra avancerade produkter, där IT-säkerhet är en central del. Du kommer att arbeta med att skapa systemlösningar för att skydda både information och teknologi, och säkerställa att våra produkter inte bara lever upp till höga säkerhetskrav utan också följer relevanta regelverk och standarder.
   

  

 Du kommer att vara med och forma systemarkitekturen, och genom hela processen – från att förstå kund- och marknadens krav till att realisera våra produkter – kommer du att vara en viktig del i att leverera säkra och hållbara lösningar. Med din expertis inom IT-säkerhet kommer du att arbeta proaktivt med att säkerställa att våra produkter följer de krav och regelverk som gäller, samtidigt som du bidrar med din erfarenhet i riskanalyser och säkerhetsbedömningar.
   

  

 I en agil arbetsmiljö får du möjligheten att samarbeta med erfarna kollegor och vara i ständig dialog med kunder och andra intressenter. Du blir en del av avdelningen Air som levererar ledningssystem både till det svenska flygvapnet och till internationella kunder.
   

  

 Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:
   

  

* Utveckla och designa IT-säkerhetslösningar för våra produkter, med målet att säkerställa efterlevnad av gällande regelverk och säkerhetskrav.
* Analysera kund- och marknadskrav och säkerställ att de möter både säkerhetsstandarder och relevanta regelverk.
* Definiera och specificera systemkrav för projekten, för att säkerställa att säkerhetsstandarder och tekniska krav uppfylls.
* Genomföra grundliga riskanalyser inom IT-säkerhet för att identifiera och bedöma potentiella hot och sårbarheter.
* Genomföra säkerhetsrelaterade tester.
* Dokumentera och redovisa de genomförda säkerhetslösningarna på ett tydligt sätt för att bevisa att alla relevanta krav och regelverk har uppfyllts.


*Din profil*
 För att trivas i denna roll är du en självgående och kommunikativ person som är van vid att samarbeta effektivt med både teammedlemmar och andra intressenter. Du är strukturerad och har ett självsäkert tankesätt som gör att du kan anpassa dig till förändrade omständigheter.
   

  

 Du är nyfiken och söker ständigt ny kunskap för att utvecklas. Du har en god samarbetsförmåga och kan samtidigt stå på dig när det behövs. Flexibilitet och förmågan att ta initiativ är också något du känner dig bekväm med. Därtill har du mycket goda kunskaper inom IT-säkerhet.
   

  

 Erforderliga färdigheter:
   

  

* Goda kunskaper inom IT-säkerhet, med erfarenhet av att skapa produkter med ett säkerhetsperspektiv inom produktutveckling
* Erfarenhet av att bedöma IT-säkerhet för komplexa system, inklusive både hård- och mjukvara i avancerade projekt
* Förmåga att argumentera för och främja relevanta lösningar i ett system
* God analytisk förmåga
* Mycket god kommunikationsförmåga på både svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift
* Tekniska ledaregenskaper


 Meriterande:
   

  

* Kandidatexamen i ingenjörsvetenskap, datavetenskap, gärna med fokus på IT-säkerhet
* Erfarenhet av att designa säkerhetslösningar för IT-system
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med militära system eller andra säkerhetskritiska system
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med säkerhetsloggning och/eller SIEM-lösningar
* Certifierad inom CompTIA Security+, GIAC GPEN, CISSP, EC-Council CEH eller liknande
* Ackreditering


*Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.*
*Vad du blir en del av*
 Bakom våra innovationer finns alla de som har gjort det möjligt. Modiga pionjärer och kluriga tänkare. Vardagshjältar och kreativa problemlösare. De som delar djup kunskap och de som utforskar nya områden. Och alla däremellan.
   

  

 Här har du chansen att påverka och bidra på ditt unika sätt. Allt från att utveckla kod och bygga imponerande försvars- och säkerhetslösningar till att ta en kaffe med en kollega. Varje bidrag räknas. Vi ger dig möjlighet att anta utmaningar och skapa smarta innovationer. I vår vänliga och tekniksmarta värld finns plats för dig att växa. Vi finns här för att tillsammans skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen.
   

  

 Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 25,500 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.
   

  

 Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här.
   

  

 Vänligen observera att vi arbetar med löpande urval och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum har gått ut.

title: Strategy Associate (x/f/m)
description:
**Your mission**
 We’re looking for a sharp and hands-on
 **Strategy Associate** 
 to join our CEO/CFO office. You’ll work directly with our leadership team on a broad range of topics – from crafting investor and board presentations to driving internal strategic projects and building management systems.
   

  

 This is a high-impact role for someone who thrives in fast-moving environments, has strong analytical and communication skills, and wants to help shape the growth trajectory of a climate-tech scale-up from the inside out.
   

  

 YOUR TASKS
   

  

* Prepare high-quality materials for investors, the board, and management team.
* Drive strategic and operational planning processes across the company.
* Support internal projects with program and project management.
* Conduct financial modelling and scenario analysis to inform decision-making.
* Research markets, trends, and competitors in the battery, solar, and heat sectors.
* Be a sparring partner for the leadership team and help turn ideas into structured initiatives.
* Build clarity and alignment in an organization growing quickly.


**Your profile**
* 1–2 years of experience in management consulting, a high-growth startup/scale-up, or a corporate strategy role
* Engineering or technical background with a strong strategic/business mindset
* Solid skills in presentation building and financial modeling – the classic “consulting toolbox”
* Interest or experience in climate tech, energy, batteries, solar, or industrial heat
* Comfortable working independently, but collaborative and low-ego
* Bonus: internships in relevant areas or roles if you're applying straight out of university


**Why us?**
* A front-row seat to the strategic and financial engine room of a growing climate-tech company
* The chance to learn directly from (and challenge) our leadership team
* Ownership, autonomy, and the opportunity to scale your impact quickly
* A mission-driven culture, flat hierarchy, and a highly collaborative team
* Attractive compensation, stock options, 30 days vacation, hybrid working, visa support.


**About Us**
 Join the Energy Revolution!
   

  

 Are you ready to make a real impact in the world of energy? Join us in driving the transition to renewable energy and be part of an exciting journey towards a more sustainable future.
   

  

 Our Mission: We are on a mission to power the planet with positive energy. Our vision is to be the leading force in renewable energy through pioneering new technologies.
   

  

 What We Do: We develop a patented nano-paste screen-printing technology. It’s used in manufacturing of solar cells, batteries and heating, proven to have superior performance, at a much lower cost and a near-zero impact on the environment. Our technology is manufactured in Europe using only abundant non-toxic materials.
   

  

 Your Role: Be part of groundbreaking projects, including from developing cutting-edge solar cell printing techniques to crafting game-changing solid-state batteries and ultra-efficient electric heaters, your contributions will directly impact the future of renewable energy.
   

  

 Why Join Us: Work with a passionate, international team in an inclusive environment where your ideas matter. At our company, creativity and boldness are celebrated, and your work will help shape a cleaner, greener future.
   

  

 Your Opportunity: Don’t wait for change—create it! Join us in revolutionizing the energy industry and making a lasting positive impact on the world by applying today!

title: Senior mjukvaruutvecklare
description:
**Är du redo att ta nästa steg och arbeta med banbrytande utveckling av inbyggd programvara? Vill du vara en del av ett härligt team där din expertis kan skapa verklig förändring och utveckling hos våra kunder? Häng med oss på Together Tech i Stockholm och bidra till utvecklingen av hållbara, högkvalitativa inbyggda system!**
**Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden**
* Designa, utveckla och underhålla inbyggda programvarulösningar för produkter hos kunder som kräver hög kvalitet och tillförlitlighet.
* Arbeta genom hela produktutvecklingens livscykel, från koncept till design, testning och implementering.
* Skriva effektiv, strukturerad och väldokumenterad kod i C eller C++ för inbyggda Linux-plattformar.
* Samarbeta med tvärfunktionella team för sömlösa projektleveranser.
* Engagera dig i felsökning, verifiering och validering av inbyggda system
* Bidra till en kultur av kunskapsdelning, innovation och lagarbete


**Din tekniska bakgrund**
* Master- eller kandidatexamen i datavetenskap, IT, mjukvara eller motsvarande
* Professionell erfarenhet av att utveckla programvara för inbyggda system i C++, Python eller C#, i Linux-baserade plattformar.
* Djup förståelse för inbyggd mjukvara och interaktion mellan mjukvara och hårdvarukomponenter.
* Mycket god kommunikationsförmåga på svenska och engelska, både muntligt och skriftligt


 En del av våra uppdrag finns inom säkerhetsklassade områden och för dessa krävs en säkerhetsprövning som en del av rekryteringsprocessen. Svenskt medborgarskap är krav i säkerhetsklassade uppdrag.
   

  

**Personliga egenskaper**
* Nyfiken, anpassningsbar och öppen för att lära dig nya tekniker och metoder.
* Proaktiv, självgående och kan arbeta självständigt såväl som i team.
* Stark relationsbyggande förmåga med kollegor, kunder och partners.
* Konsultativt tankesätt med ett engagemang för att leverera hållbara lösningar av hög kvalitet.


**Together Tech - Hållbar produktutveckling**
 På Together Tech kommer du att vara en del av en samarbetsinriktad och tillväxtorienterad miljö där ingenjörer brinner för att använda teknik för varaktiga, hållbara lösningar. Vi erbjuder möjligheter till professionell utveckling genom varierande uppdrag och innovativa projekt.
   

  

**Vi stödjer din professionella och personliga utveckling med:**
* Trygg anställning, fast lön och konkurrenskraftiga förmåner och kollektivavtal.
* Friskvårdsbidrag på 4 000 kronor per år, hälsokontroller och bidrag till friskvårdsaktiviteter.
* Ett brett utbud av sociala aktiviteter – från enklare afterworks till större events tex. konferenser.
* Individuella utvecklingsplaner och kontinuerlig utbildning
* Möjlighet att arbeta med andra ledande ingenjörer i teknikuppdrag på hög nivå.


 Vi är stolta över att ha utsetts till Sveriges mest attraktiva arbetsgivare av Karriärföretagen 2024 och 2025.
   

  

 Är du redo att driva innovation inom inbyggda system på Together Tech? Ansök idag!
   

  

 Upplysningar om anställningen lämnas av, vänligen kontakta Anna Öfwerman på +46790738026

title: Senior Testledare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
* Leda, koordinera och rapportera projektets test- och kvalitetssäkringsarbete
* Ta fram, dokumentera och implementera projektets övergripande teststrategi, testplan och testrapport utifrån testprocesser/riktlinjer i samarbete med systemleverantör
* Planera, leda och delta i arbetet med att ta fram testdata, testmiljöer och testdokumentation för testaktiviteter i samarbete med systemleverantör.
* Samverka med interna och externa infrastruktur-, utvecklings-, och driftteam.
* Utföra integration- och acceptanstester på främst windowsklient-plattformar.
* Arbeta enligt anvisningar och styrdokument samt övriga relevanta externa regelverk etc.


**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Högskole-/universitetsutbildning 120p/180hp inom data/systemvetenskap.
* Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet i rollen som testledare inom IT-projekt och därmed arbetat med funktionella och icke funktionella krav under de senaste 10 åren.
* Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att ha arbetat med kvalitetssäkring, testutförande, testledning och testmetodik.
* Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet av krav- och test inom IT-utveckling enligt agila arbetssätt.
* Erhållen certifiering som testare/testledare enligt ISTQB eller motsvarande.
* God skriftlig och muntlig kommunikationsförmåga på svenska och engelska.


**Meriterande**
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av test eller testledning inom säkerhetskänslig verksamhet, involverande kritiska IT-system med hög skyddsklass.
* Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av verktyg som Azure DevOps eller liknande.


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 17-06-2025
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: BI Specialist - Swedish Speaker
description:
Hi all,
   

  

 We are hunting for BI Specialist - Swedish Speaker & Citizen to our reputed client in Stockholm.
   

  

 About Us:
   

  

 ITIVE AB is seeking a highly skilled BI Specialist to join our client team in Stockholm . As a BI Specialist, you will be responsible for the design, development, and implementation of BI for our clients.
   

  

 Job Overview :
   

  

 Knowledge - High generalist competence or very high competence in the field. Education equivalent to a bachelor's degree or equivalent knowledge acquired through work experience in the field.
   

  

 Experience - Has participated in large assignments in various areas and completed assignments with very high quality. The level is normally achieved at the earliest after 912 years of experience in the area. Has been at level 3 in terms of competence for at least 2 years.
   

  

 Takes primary responsibility for managing a larger group.
   

  

 Independence Very high
   

  

 Location : The consultant will primarily work at Stadshagen. Remote work may be permitted to the extent that it is compatible with the needs of the project and the employer's decision.
   

  

 Mission start during the period June-August 2025
   

  

**Mission Description**
 Kompetensroll BI (Business Intelligence) -specialist:
   

  

 The competency profile possesses the competence to be responsible for the development and streamlining of information management, which means participating in all stages of the development and management process, everything from feasibility studies, conceptual design and development.
   

  

 The BI specialist is responsible for strategically designing and implementing BI systems, including integration with databases and data warehouses.
   

  

 The BI specialist works with new development and management of analysis and reporting solutions, as well as continuous work on optimizing and streamlining applications, implementing data analyses of varying nature and complexity.
   

  

**Job duties:**
* Development of logical and physical data models according to Kimball and star schema
* Documentation of conceptual and information structures and model descriptions
* Quality assurance and validation of data
* Management of metadata and work with data catalogs
* Collaboration with BI developers on fact tables, dimensions and visualization solutions
* Translation of business needs into technical models and information flows
* Requirements analysis and documentation for modeling, integration and reporting needs
* version management of models in ongoing projects
* The consultancy service covers 100%. The assignment is intended to start during the period June-August 2025, with the exact start date as agreed upon when signing the contract. Early start is desirable, but the client is flexible. The assignment runs until 2026-12-31.


 Why Join Us:
   

  

* Opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology and innovative solutions
* Collaborative and inclusive work environment
* Competitive salary and benefits package
* Career growth and development opportunities
* Work-life balance and flexible working hours
* International and diverse team
* Chance to make a real impact and contribute to the success of our clients


 If you are a passionate and experienced BI Specialist Consultant looking for a new challenge, we would love to hear from you! Apply now asap.

title: Store Manager
description:
**COMPANY – Who’s JOE?** 




 Joe & the Juice is a fast-growing freshly made juice, coffee, and sandwich concept. JOE was founded in Copenhagen in 2002 and has grown to +360 stores across 18 countries with more than 4.000 employees worldwide. The brand offers a healthy, convenient, and ambient experience when entering our universe and our concept extends beyond just the products themselves, but about the people behind them.
 



  





 We are a people business, and our goal is to become the first truly global people-centric food & beverage company. To achieve this, we strive to continuously develop a unique culture based on our virtues as the backbone of our company’s success:
 *Positive Attitud* 
 e,
 *Inclusio* 
 n,
 *Social Tie* 
 s, and
 *Growth.* 
 By focusing on having a high degree of
 *Employee Engagemen* 
 t, we rely on our employees to adhere to and promote our virtues, leading to a high employee belonging
 **.** 




  





**JOB SUMMARY – What it’s all about** 




**Position title** 
 : Store Manager
 



**Reports to** 
 : District Manager
 



**Job Location** 
 : Stockholm
 



**Job Post closing date** 
 : 03.07.2025
 



  





 As a Store Manager, you are responsible for the daily operation of your store, ensuring the highest performance possible in all areas within the operation. You will adhere to market-specific legal requirements, company policies, and risk & compliance structures. By leading and engaging your team you will create great guest experiences leading to an optimized overall store performance.
 



  





 Your overall success in this position depends on the degree to which you can lead, develop, and retain a highly engaged team, where all operational conceptual in-store requirements are followed to deliver best-in-class guest experiences turning regular customers into beloved returning guests. Ultimately you are accountable for meeting the cost budget, reaching the store’s sales targets, and EBITDA through existing and new company initiatives.
 



  





**KEY RESPONSIBIL** 
 I
 **TIES – What you’ll do** 



* **Operational Requirements:** 
 Maintain a safe and healthy work environment, while ensuring conceptual store structures are maintained, by enforcing hygiene, health, and safety standards, resulting in the highest local standards and ratings.
* **Employee Engagement:** 
 Develop and engage your team through development plans and feedback, in-store training, team meetings, and securing the employee engagement score meets or exceeds the true benchmark score.
* **Guest Experience:** 
 Ensure a guest-first approach, building strong guest relations through your local community in accordance with our brand behavior principles and hereby increase overall guest loyalty and overall optimized store performance.
* **Performance Management:** 
 Accountable for building sales and optimizing store EBITDA to achieve or exceed defined KPI targets.
* **Recruitment Practices** 
 : Responsible for the candidate selection, pre-boarding, and onboarding of team members, and hereby the optimal team positioning, and future store talent pipeline.
* **Value-Based Leadership:** 
 Effectively lead your team members in alignment with company virtues and operational principles.



  





**KEY QUALIFICATIONS - What experience you’ll add to the team** 



* Minimum 2 years of experience in a similar leadership role
* Experience in operating store(s) in a food & beverage chain is a requirement
* Experience in leading teams of +10 employees
* Excellent interpersonal and leadership skills
* Strong analytical and performance management skills
* A proven track record in optimizing overall store performance



  





**THE JUICE – Overview of your benefits and perks** 



* Employee meal plan
* Free coffee – duh’
* New parent leave
* An opportunity to make a real impact on the people around you, both by growing them and by connecting them to real food
* A collaborative team of people who live our core values and have your back
* A clear career path with opportunities for development, both personally and professionally



  





  





**DOCUMENTS REQUIREMENTS – For the entire application process** 



* Resume
* List of professional references

title: Manager, Safety Surveillance Research Scientist
description:
***All over the world, Pfizer colleagues are working together to positively impact health for everyone, everywhere. As we continue to create breakthroughs that change patients' lives, we are looking for new talents.***
***Right now, we are seeking highly qualified candidates to fill the position:***
**Manager Safety Surveillance Research Scientist**
**Role Summary**
 Under the guidance of the Safety Surveillance Research (SSR) unit lead, this role develops and executes post-approval pharmacoepidemiology/real world evidence research strategies to assess potential safety risks and investigate new safety signals, assess effectiveness of risk management, ensure compliance with global regulatory commitments, and inform benefit-risk decisions about Pfizer medicines.
   

  

**Role Responsibilities**
 Under the guidance and supervision of the SSR unit lead, and with the review and approval of all deliverables by SSR management, the SSR scientist will
   

  

* Contribute to the design and implementation of real-world, de novo, or hybrid design studies intended to quantify risks potentially associated with Pfizer products or to assess the effectiveness of risk mitigation activities. Complexity of study designs will be lower in comparison to other levels within the SSR organization.
* Contribute to the development of post-approval safety studies required as a condition for product approval or to investigate signals arising post-approval. Volume and complexity of these studies will be lower in comparison to other levels within the SSR organization.
* Contribute to the design and implementation of other epidemiology strategies to investigate safety signals arising post-approval, such as critical review of publication on Pfizer products and real-world data queries
* Build skill set to adequately interact with regulatory agencies on safety epidemiologic issues as needed, via written and/or verbal communications
* As appropriate and with managerial oversight, consult on safety-related issues in pre-approval research strategies, such as defining safety endpoints in standing cohorts
* Participate in Risk Management Committee activities related to post-approval epidemiology strategies as needed
* Contribute to epidemiology sections of risk management plans with appropriate oversight from unit lead and/or senior SSR colleagues
* Support vendor management oversight activities, as applicable, with appropriate oversight from unit lead and/or senior SSR colleagues
* Present and publish results of safety epidemiological studies at scientific conferences and peer-reviewed journals
* Work collaboratively with key stakeholders internally (such as Safety Risk Leads, RM CoE Leads, Clinical, Medical, Regulatory) and externally (such as academics, regulators, vendors)
* Support other SSR colleagues as required
* As appropriate and with managerial oversight, consult on design of key post-approval safety studies required by single-country health authorities outside the US and EU
* May be responsible for negotiating and overseeing observational study budgets
* Participate in internal and external initiatives related to safety epidemiology


**Basic Qualifications**
 Candidate demonstrates a breadth of diverse experiences and capabilities including: the ability to learn quickly, adapt to a rapidly changing environment, and influence and collaborate with peers to achieve meaningful outcomes and create business impact.
   

  

* Doctoral degree in Epidemiology/Quantitative Public Health Discipline or Doctor of Medicine (MD or equivalent) with a Master's degree in Epidemiology/Quantitative Public Health Discipline
* Experience from the pharmaceutical industry, academia, and/or regulatory agencies
* In-depth understanding of and expertise in epidemiologic methods, including observational and experimental study designs and analysis, and appropriate sample size calculation methodology
* Experience writing epidemiological sections of scientific documents such as research summaries, publications, grant proposals, risk management plans, etc.
* Independently serve as safety research lead of projects with some regulatory/methodologic complexity such as enhanced surveillance or drug utilization; or for less complex projects, lead independently with minimal mentorship


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Practical experience with implementation of observational or experimental studies
* Demonstrated ability to negotiate scientific and operational decisions with cross-functional teams, external collaborators;, and support regulatory interactions
* Experience in applying epidemiologic methods to study the safety of medicines preferred
* Experience participating in internal strategic initiatives and/or representing Pfizer in select external initiatives


**Other Job Details:**
 This role is to be site based in Europe, at any current Pfizer location. Flexibility home office/site is 50-50. You will be part of a global team and manager is located in the US.
   

  

 There is no relocation assistance available for this position.
   

  

 Join us in making breakthroughs that change patients lives.
   

  

 We are looking forward to your CV/resume and cover letter in English as soon as possible.
   

  

*Pfizer is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable equal employment opportunity legislation in each jurisdiction in which it operates.*
 Equal Employment Opportunity
   

  

 We believe that a diverse and inclusive workforce is crucial to building a successful business. As an employer, Pfizer is committed to celebrating this, in all its forms – allowing for us to be as diverse as the patients and communities we serve. Together, we continue to build a culture that encourages, supports and empowers our employees.
   

  

 Disability Inclusion
   

  

 Our mission is unleashing the power of all our people and we are proud to be a disability inclusive employer, ensuring equal employment opportunities for all candidates. We encourage you to put your best self forward with the knowledge and trust that we will make any reasonable adjustments to support your application and future career. Your journey with Pfizer starts here!
   

  

 Medical

title: Winback Specialist (Danish speaking)
description:
**Working at Mercell**
 At Mercell, we're on a mission to revolutionise public procurement, making it accessible and effortless for everyone involved. Imagine a world where public buyers and visionary suppliers come together seamlessly to make a great deal easier and shape the future. That's what we're all about.
   

  

 With a dynamic culture built on continuous growth, trust, and collaboration, Mercell offers an environment where your talents can thrive. You will be part of an international environment with ambitious and dedicated colleagues who are passionate about what they do and supported to be themselves.
   

  

**Your Mission**
 This is an opportunity to make a significant impact on Mercell's success by minimizing churn and maximizing customer retention within the Nordic Public Procurement sector. As a Winback Specialist at Mercell, you will report to the Head of Customer Success and be a crucial part of our customer-facing teams, collaborating closely with sales, customer success, and support. Your mission is to proactively re-engage churned customers, understand their reasons for leaving, provide tailored solutions, and convert them back into loyal Mercell users. This role is vital in recovering lost revenue, ensuring accurate data management, and contributing directly to the company's growth and stability.
   

  

**Core Responsibilities**
* Proactively engage with churned customers (both early and late), conducting thorough investigations into the reasons for churn.
* Develop and execute effective strategies to re-engage and secure the return of dissatisfied clients.
* Act as the primary contact for churned customers, providing exceptional service and support throughout the winback process.
* Ensure accurate and timely data management for all winback activities, contributing to reliable reporting and analysis.
* Handle specific cases involving cancellation requests, ensuring correct process execution and the proper setup of new agreements when applicable.


**Required Qualifications**
* Proven experience in outbound sales or a highly proactive customer-facing role, particularly within a SaaS environment.
* Demonstrated success in achieving and exceeding targets and KPIs.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills, including proficiency in cold calling and persuasive email writing.
* Resilience and persistence in outbound outreach, with a track record of overcoming objections and navigating challenging interactions.
* Fluency in Danish and English language.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Curiosity and a consultative mindset, with the ability to identify customer needs and tailor solutions effectively.
* Ability to learn and convey value propositions clearly and compellingly.
* Strong time management and self-organization skills, with a focus on prioritizing high-impact activities.
* Experience with CRM systems such as SalesForce or HubSpot.
* Experience within the public procurement market is a plus.


**Start date:** 
 As soon as possible
   

  

**Duration:** 
 Full time
   

  

**Workplace type:** 
 Hybrid remote
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

**Application Deadline:** 
**June 30** 
**, 2025.** 
 However, do not wait to submit your application - we will read applications and talk to potential candidates as we receive them
   

  

**What We Offer**
 As a growing technology company, we are committed to taking care of our employees through initiatives such as hybrid work to support your work-life balance, health and insurance plans (may differ per country/office), pension plans, paid parental leave, social happenings and competitive salary packages. Please see https://career.mercell.com/post/our-perks-benefits to get more insights on what to expect of perks, benefits and culture when joining Mercell.
   

  

**Has this sparked your interest?**
 Then we can't wait to have you join our mission and look forward to receiving your application!
   

  

 We may carry out background checks on applicants to verify information that appears on CVs and other documentation. This background check is carried out by an external party and is not carried out without the consent of the applicant. Current applicants will receive further information about this.

title: Senior Accountant - Stockholm
Paralegal to atNorth
company_industry: Legal Services, Construction, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
atNorth is a fast-growing Nordic data center company, operating across Iceland, Sweden, Finland, and Denmark. As they continue to scale up infrastructure and operations, we are looking for a Paralegal/Supplier Contract Specialist to support the sourcing and procurement teams with structured, efficient contract management—ensuring compliance and clarity at every step.
 



  





 This is a great opportunity to bring your legal and organizational expertise into a dynamic, high-growth environment where technology, operational excellence, and sustainability come together to shape the future of digital infrastructure.
 



  





**The Role** 




 As a Paralegal/Supplier Contract Specialist, you will be responsible for establishing and maintaining a centralized, up-to-date supplier contract database, ensuring that all contracts and related documentation are accurately filed and regularly reviewed for compliance with internal policies. You will manage the consultancy process for supplier agreements, overseeing the documentation and facilitating the signing of contracts and NDAs between suppliers and internal stakeholders.
 



  





 In addition, you will develop and manage supplier compliance frameworks, maintaining detailed records of performance evaluations and regulatory adherence. Your role will also include supporting the drafting and review of contracts for legal accuracy, assisting procurement and supply chain teams with administrative tasks, and participating in internal training sessions related to supplier contract management and compliance.
 



 This role gives you an opportunity to be part of an exciting journey of growth within a future-oriented industry with an increasing demand. By using your analytical skills and knowledge within construction and development projects, you will be playing a key role in contributing to our growth and operational excellence.
 



  





**Is this you?** 




 To be successful in this position we see that you have a education within parlegal , a bachelor’s degree preferably in finance, or equivalent experience. You have 3+ years experience in contract management, procurement, or supplier relations, within construction or industryrelated field. You have good understanding of contract law and regulatory compliance.
 



  





 Excellent organizational skills and attention to details as well as being proficient in contract management software and Microsoft Office Suite is mandatory. You have great skills in spoken and written English, other Scandinavian language is seen as a plus.
 



  





 As a person you are analytical, meticulous, and independent in your way of working with excellent communications skills. You take initiative to drive your work forwards and possess great diplomatic skills while having the experience of navigating stakeholders on different levels. You thrive in a fast-paced environment and are driven by having an impactful roll. Due to the rapid growth we are experiencing, it is important that you are not only stress resistant but also have a dynamic and flexible way of working as circumstances and needs can change quickly.
 



  





**Do you want to know more?** 




 In this process atNorth is working with Level Recruitment. To apply, please press apply. If you have any questions please contact recruitment consultant Carolina Eskengren at 08-120 50 427.
 



 Please note that applications will not be accepted by email. The selection process is ongoing.
 



  





 You are welcome to submit your application!
